Package NumberConverterSystem.Controllers

Class ConverterController

java.lang.Object
NumberConverterSystem.Controllers.ConverterController
public class ConverterController extends Object
The ConverterController class provides static utility methods for converting numbers between different bases, handling both integer and fractional parts. It also manages conversion history for users, including undo functionality.

This controller is designed to be used in a session-based environment where each user can perform multiple conversions and maintain a history of their actions. It supports conversion of both integer-only and decimal numbers, with error handling for invalid input values.

Features:

  • Detects if a number is integer-only or contains a fractional part.
  • Converts integer numbers from a source base to a target base.
  • Converts fractional numbers from a source base to a target base with configurable precision.
  • Handles conversion errors gracefully and provides error messages.
  • Tracks conversion history for each user and allows undoing the last conversion.

Usage Example: 

 String result = ConverterController.convertNumber(userId, "101.11", 2, 10);
 boolean undone = ConverterController.undoLastConversion(userId);

Since:
2025-08-26

  • Constructor Details

    • ConverterController

      public ConverterController()

  • Method Details

    • isIntegerOnly

      public static boolean isIntegerOnly(String value)
      Checks if the provided string value represents an integer-only number (i.e., does not contain a decimal point).
      Parameters:
      value - The string representation of the number to check.
      Returns:
      true if the value does not contain a decimal point and is thus integer-only; false otherwise.

    • convertIntegerToTargetBase

      public static String convertIntegerToTargetBase(String inputValue, int sourceBase, int targetBase)
      Converts an integer value from a specified source base to a target base.

      This method parses the input string as an integer in the source base, then converts it to the target base. If the input is invalid for the given source base, an error message is returned.

      Parameters:
      inputValue - The string representation of the integer value to convert.
      sourceBase - The base in which the input value is represented (e.g., 2 for binary, 10 for decimal).
      targetBase - The base to which the value should be converted.
      Returns:
      The converted value as a string in the target base, or an error message if conversion fails.

    • convertDecimalToTargetBase

      public static String convertDecimalToTargetBase(String inputValue, int sourceBase, int targetBase)
      Converts a decimal number (with both integer and fractional parts) from a source base to a target base.

      The method splits the input value into integer and fractional parts, converts each part separately, and then combines them into the final result. The fractional part is converted with a fixed precision of 5 digits.

      Parameters:
      inputValue - The string representation of the decimal number to convert (e.g., "101.11").
      sourceBase - The base in which the input value is represented.
      targetBase - The base to which the value should be converted.
      Returns:
      The converted value as a string in the target base, combining both integer and fractional parts.

    • convertNumber

      public static String convertNumber(int userId, String inputValue, int sourceBase, int targetBase)
      Converts a number (integer or decimal) from a source base to a target base for a specific user.

      This method determines whether the input value is integer-only or contains a fractional part, performs the appropriate conversion, and records the conversion in the user's session history. If the user is not found, an error message is printed and an empty string is returned.

      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user performing the conversion.
      inputValue - The string representation of the number to convert.
      sourceBase - The base in which the input value is represented.
      targetBase - The base to which the value should be converted.
      Returns:
      The converted value as a string in the target base, or an error message if conversion fails.

    • undoLastConversion

      public static boolean undoLastConversion(int userId)
      Undoes the last conversion performed by the specified user in the current session.

      This method removes the most recent conversion from the user's session history and increments the user's undo count. If there are no conversions to undo, it returns false.

      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user requesting the undo operation.
      Returns:
      true if the last conversion was successfully undone; false if there were no conversions to undo.
